item.title: Rl in Virtual Economics
item.description:
Reinforcement Learning in Virtual Economies:

Table of Contents

  • Governing DeFi with AI
  • DeFi vs Traditional Finance: Lending by Numbers
  • The Utilization Curve: How Interest Rates Work in DeFi
  • Loan-to-Value (LTV) and Overcollateralization
  • Why RL in DeFi Governance?
  • The RL Workflow in DeFi
  • Results: RL vs Rule-Based Governance
  • Conclusion
  • References

Governing DeFi with AI

Virtual economies are no longer confined to video games. With the rise of cryptocurrencies and Decentralized Finance (DeFi), we now have financial ecosystems that exist entirely on-chain. These systems facilitate lending, borrowing, and trading without traditional intermediaries like banks. Instead, they rely on smart contractsâ€”self-executing code deployed on blockchains.

item.title: Actor-Critic vs. Value-Based: Empirical Trade-offs
item.description: An empirical comparison of Value-Based and Actor-Critic reinforcement learning algorithms across discrete and continuous action spaces, analyzing trade-offs in convergence speed, stability, and performance.

item.title: ExpGen: Explore to Generalize in Zero-Shot RL
item.description: by Ev Zisselman, Itai Lavie, Daniel Soudry, and Aviv Tamar
